short_description: Fits a Gaussian Mixture Model to data.
long_description: Clusters data using a Gaussian Mixture Model or a Dirichlet Process Gaussian Mixture Model.

input_tables.name: init_params
input_tables.rDescription: Contains initial values for the cluster weights, means, and covariances. The user may specify one, two, or all three of the cluster parameters.
input_tables.description: Contains initial values for the cluster weights, means, and covariances. The user may specify one, two, or all three of the cluster parameters.

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.rDescription: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queen’s IP address or hostname.
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queen’s IP address or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the database where the input table is located.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.rDescription: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.rDescription: The Aster Database password of the user.
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.rDescription: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.rDescription: The password for the SSL truststore.
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: InputTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the input data to be clustered.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the input data to be clustered.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output table to which the function outputs cluster information. The table must not already exist.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the output table to which the function outputs cluster information. The table must not already exist.

argument_clauses.name: MaxClusterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of clusters in a Dirichlet Process model and causes the function to use the DP-GMM algorithm. This value must have the data type INTEGER. The default value is 20.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of clusters in a Dirichlet Process model and causes the function to use the DP-GMM algorithm. This value must have the data type INTEGER. The default value is 20.

argument_clauses.name: ClusterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of clusters in a model and causes the function to use  the basic GMM algorithm. This value must have the data type INTEGER and be greater than 0. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of clusters in a model and causes the function to use  the basic GMM algorithm. This value must have the data type INTEGER and be greater than 0. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: CovarianceType
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the type of the covariance matrices, thereby determining how many parameters the function estimates for each cluster: 'spherical': Each covariance matrix is of the form σI. The function estimates one parameter for each cluster, 'diagonal' (default): Each covariance matrix has zeroes on the nondiagonal. The function estimates D parameters for each cluster, where D is the number of dimensions in the matrix, 'tied': Each cluster has the same covariance matrix. The function estimates (1/2)D(D-1) parameters, 'full': Each cluster has an arbitrary covariance matrix. The function estimates (1/2)D(D-1) parameters for each cluster.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the type of the covariance matrices, thereby determining how many parameters the function estimates for each cluster: 'spherical': Each covariance matrix is of the form σI. The function estimates one parameter for each cluster, 'diagonal' (default): Each covariance matrix has zeroes on the nondiagonal. The function estimates D parameters for each cluster, where D is the number of dimensions in the matrix, 'tied': Each cluster has the same covariance matrix. The function estimates (1/2)D(D-1) parameters, 'full': Each cluster has an arbitrary covariance matrix. The function estimates (1/2)D(D-1) parameters for each cluster.

argument_clauses.name: Tolerance
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the minimum change in log-likelihood between iterations that causes the function to terminate. This value must have the data type DOUBLE PRECISION and be greater than 0. The default value is 0.001.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the minimum change in log-likelihood between iterations that causes the function to terminate. This value must have the data type DOUBLE PRECISION and be greater than 0. The default value is 0.001.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of iterations for which the function runs. This value must have the data type INTEGER and be greater than 0. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations for which the function runs. This value must have the data type INTEGER and be greater than 0. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: ConcentrationParam
argument_clauses.rDescription: Note: Specify this argument only if you specify max.cluster.num. Specifies the concentration parameter, α, which determines the number of clusters that the DP-GMM algorithm generates. This value must have the data type DOUBLE PRECISION and be greater than 0. The expected number of clusters is α log N, where N is the number of points in the data set; therefore, a larger α value tends to cause the algorithm to find more clusters.
argument_clauses.description: Note: Specify this argument only if you specify MaxClusterNum. Specifies the concentration parameter, α, which determines the number of clusters that the DP-GMM algorithm generates. This value must have the data type DOUBLE PRECISION and be greater than 0. The expected number of clusters is α log N, where N is the number of points in the data set; therefore, a larger α value tends to cause the algorithm to find more clusters.

argument_clauses.name: PackOutput
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the function packs the output. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the function packs the output. The default value is 'false'.
